p:
There exist nine subtypes (denoted as A, B, C, D, F, G, H, J and K) and at least 61 circulating recombinant forms (CRFs) within HIV-1 group M
7 . There are differences among HIV-1 variants in several biological features. For instance, some subtypes and CRFs are associated to a faster progression to AIDS than others
8, 9 . Genetic and antigenic differences among HIV-1 subtypes and CRFs are also a challenge for the development of an effective HIV-1 vaccine
10 .
